overview_summary: Of the four neighboring landowners, only one – a public trust – has an evident pro-development stance, while none have been publicly opposed; the other three have no recorded stance. Community influence is concentrated in that trust (high influence), as the remaining neighbors are private individuals with low public influence.

neighbors.name: Oowa
neighbors.claims: The Oklahoma Ordnance Works Authority (OOWA) – a public trust formed in 1960 – acquired over 10,000 acres of the former ordnance plant in Mayes County ([www.okhistory.org](https://www.okhistory.org/publications/enc/entry?entry=OK069#:~:text=Created%20in%20December%201960%2C%20the,computer%2C%20and%20aviation%20industries%2C%20among)). OOWA operates MidAmerica Industrial Park and its mission is to promote industrial development on that land ([www.okhistory.org](https://www.okhistory.org/publications/enc/entry?entry=OK069#:~:text=million,OOWA%20retains%20its%20administrative%20functions)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage OOWA leadership through formal channels; emphasize how the project aligns with MidAmerica Industrial Park’s economic development goals.
Not applicable; federal government ownership with no individual neighbor to engage.

neighbors.name: Harris, Ila F & Lillian Tucker
neighbors.claims: Ila F. Harris and Lillian Tucker jointly own two parcels in a rural, agricultural part of Mayes County ([www.datacrosspoint.com](https://www.datacrosspoint.com/mayes-county-property-search/#:~:text=Whether%20you%E2%80%99re%20researching%20lakeview%20property,a%20trip%20to%20the%20courthouse)). No mention of Harris or Tucker was found in local meetings or news archives, indicating they have not publicly taken a stance on development issues ([mayes.okcounties.org](https://mayes.okcounties.org/meetings#:~:text=The%20Board%20is%20required%20by,Source)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally (or via a trusted local farm community contact) to build rapport and listen to any concerns, emphasizing respect for their land and openness to dialogue.

neighbors.name: Stoner, Larry Allen & Sarah Opdycke & Larry Opdycke
neighbors.claims: Larry Allen Stoner appears as a co-owner alongside Larry Opdycke and Sarah Opdycke on at least one Mayes County property, according to assessor records ([www.datacrosspoint.com](https://www.datacrosspoint.com/mayes-county-property-search/#:~:text=,ID%20or%20legal%20description%20with)). No evidence of any of these family members speaking at public meetings or holding civic roles could be found in available records ([mayes.okcounties.org](https://mayes.okcounties.org/meetings#:~:text=The%20Board%20is%20required%20by,Source)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Arrange a meeting with all co-owners present to ensure everyone’s questions are addressed; emphasize transparency about the project and a willingness to accommodate reasonable concerns.
